hook.text: Kennedy beat Nixon because he looked better on TV. Media doesn't just cover elections â€” it decides them.

buildup.text: Campaign coverage focuses on polls, gaffes, and personality. Policy substance gets a fraction of the airtime.

discovery.text: Studies show media tone toward candidates affects election outcomes. Negative coverage can sink campaigns.

twist.text: Trump got $5 billion in free media in 2016. Coverage was mostly negative but the attention was priceless.

climax.text: Social media lets candidates bypass traditional media entirely. They speak directly to voters unfiltered.

punchline.text: Media coverage wins or loses elections. Attention matters more than accuracy.

quiz.question: How did Trump benefit from media coverage in 2016?
options: He received about $5 billion in free media attention despite mostly negative coverage
He received no media coverage at all
All media coverage was positive and supportive
